Julian Huff
Senior IT Manager | Experienced Strategist & Leader | Seeking opportunities in IT Infrastructure & IT Service Management
March 18, 2013, Julian was a client of Gary’s

Gary Bennett has proven to be an excellent resource for training.  I personally utilized his courses when I decided to try to learn iOS programming.  I had never used object oriented languages before as my coding experience was many years ago.  Within three months of taking Gary's classes, I had my first app published on the iTunes App Store!  Gary takes a very reasoned and step by step approach in his classes.  He is very responsive to questions and is willing to address any reasonable question, even if it is not exactly what's being covered at the moment.  I have referred several colleagues to Gary and they have all told me the same thing and enjoyed their experiences.  Gary manages to keep his classes personal and interact with each class member, which really enhances the program.  His knowledge is very deep as well and this enables him to warn students of potential pitfalls as well as great tips and tricks that save a lot of time and effort.I wholeheartedly recommend Gary and his training regimen.  If you are serious about learning to code for the iPhone and iPad, you owe it to yourself to give Gary Bennett's classes a try!

Kevin Collins
Operations Services Executive, Customer Engagement, Service Delivery and Operations at SAP SuccessFactors
June 21, 2012, Kevin and Gary were students together

I want to thank you for the lessons I learned in your advanced objective-c class. I recently released a new iPad app "Get Fit! Club" ( http://itunes.apple.com/us/app/get-fit!-club/id533038754?mt=8 ) to the iTunes Store. To my surprise, it has remained in the top 20 in sales in the Health and Fitness category for several days. I owe much of my success to your teachings. I hope to take more of your courses in the near future. I am really fortunate that I found Gary Bennett and xcelme.com.  Whether you are a novice or expert iOS developer, Gary and his colleagues provide you the tools to enhance your application development skills as well as your resume.  In this economy, their educational programs are very valuable.   Thank you,Kevin Collins

summary: I am a software engineer focusing on IoT and iOS applications, and by night, I teach courses on iOS development. As a developer, I have written iOS applications for large Fortune 500 companies. As the Chief Architect at Rare Labs, my team and I build great apps and technology. We specialize in developing enterprise solutions which solve complex problems in highly regulated industries.I am also the founder and President of xcelMe, an iPhone/iPad/Maker development and training company.  www.xcelMe.com is the leading online iPhone and iPad developer training company in the world.  Over the last decade, I have taught thousands of developers around the world how to write iPhone and iPad applications. In addition to development, I am also an author. I have co-authored several books, including Swift for Absolute Beginners by Apress Publishing. The third edition of this book is scheduled to release on October 2016.
name: Gary Bennett
title: Chief Architect at Rare Labs
